abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column offers guide on donating used clothes for tax deduction purposes; points out Internal Revenue Service requires varying levels of documentation.
lead_paragraph: Thrift stores may be happy to help you beef up your I.R.S. deductions for next year, but they aren’t interested in used underwear. A guide to best practices.

headline.main: Tax-Deductible Clothing Donations Are Great, Except Your Used Socks
headline.print_headline: Tax Breaks for Clothes? Keep Your Socks On

snippet: Thrift stores may be happy to help you beef up your I.R.S. deductions for next year, but they aren’t interested in used underwear. A guide to best practices.
